_meanings:
{@--1@} As a prefix to verbs
it means ({%a%}) towards, in the 
direction of; ({%b%}) back, in return, again;
({%c%}) in opposition to, against, 
counter; ({%d%}) upon, down upon; (see
the several roots with this 
preposition).

{@--5@} As
the first member of Avyayībhāva
compounds it usually means ({%a%})
in or at every; as {#pratisaMvatsaraM#} ‘every
year’; {#pratikzaRaM, pratyahaM#} &c.; ({%b%}) 
towards, in the direction of; {#pratyagni#}
{#SalaBA qayaMte#}.

{@--6@} {#prati#} is sometimes
used as the last member of <ab>Avyayī.</ab>
<ab>comp.</ab> in the sense of ‘a little’;  
{#sUpaprati, SAkaprati#}. ({%Note%}. In the 
compounds given below all words the
second members of which are words
not immediately connected with
verbs, are included; other words
will be found in their proper places)

{1} a secondary or minor limb
(of the body), as the nose.

{3} (in <ab>Rhet.</ab>) a
figure of speech in which one tries
to injure a person or thing 
connected with an enemy, who himself 
cannot be injured; {#pratipakzamaSaktena#} 
{#pratikartu tiraskriyA . yA tadIyasya tatstutyE#} 
{#pratyanIkaM taducyate#} <ls>K. P. 10.</ls>

contiguous, lying close to, adjacent,
bordering.

{2} a bordering
country; especially, a country 
occupied by barbarians or Mlecchas.

{2} very
low or degrading, very 
insignificant.

each,
each one, every single one.

{1} one by one, one at a
time, severally; singly, in every
one, to every one; <ab>oft.</ab> with the
force of an adjective; {#viveSa#} 
{#daMqakAraRyaM pratyekaM ca satAM manaH#} <ls>R. 12. 9</ls>
‘entered the mind of every good
man’; <ls n="R.">12. 3</ls>, <ls n="R.">7. 34</ls>; <ls>Ku. 2. 31.</ls>

according to
each Tantra or opinion.

a conclusion adopted by one
of the disputants only; ( 
{#vAdiprativAdyekataramAtrAByupagataH#}).

for
three days at a time.

in every
direction, all round, everywhere.

a horse harnessed by
the side of another.

{1} the opposite side,
party or faction, hostility.

with regard to each part, of
each character; {#pratipAtramADIyatAM yatnaH#}
<ls>Ś. 1</ls> ‘let care be taken of each
character’.

returning sin for sin,
requiting evil for evil.

{4} the effigy of a man pushed by
thieves into the interior of a house
before entering it themselves (to
ascertain if any body is awake).

{%<ab>ind.</ab>%}
man by man, for each man.
a copy of an original manuscript.

an equal in rank or
station.

{2} equal in strength, equally
matched or powerful.

a secondary plot or
incident in a drama which tends
either to hasten or retard the 
catastrophe; see <ls>S. D. 334</ls> and <ls n="S. D.">351-64</ls>

the
leader of a hostile herd of elephants.

{1} corresponding,
similar, having a counter-part in.
a picture, an image, a likeness.

{1}
‘against the hair or grain’, 
contrary to the natural order, inverted,
reverse (<ab>opp.</ab> {#anuloma#}).

{2} contrary
to easte (said of the issue of a
woman who is of a higher caste than
her husband).

{%<ab>a.</ab>%} born in the
inverse order of the eastes; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%}
born of a mother who is of a higher
caste than the father; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 10. 16</ls>,
<ls n="Ms. 10.">25.</ls>
being equal to or a match for.

at each
time, on every occasion.

for every branch or
school (of the Veda).
